problem_text: 21.86. (M. Gromov, B. Weiss). A group G is said to be sofic if for every finite set F ⊆ G containing 1 and every ε > 0 there exist n ∈ N and a map φ : F → S_n such that φ(1) = 1, d(φ(gh), φ(g)φ(h)) < ε for all g, h such that gh ∈ F, φ(g) does not have fixed points for every g ∈ F \ {1}. Is every group sofic? A. Lubotzky
